reference.title: euwatch-put-data
reference.shortdesc: Adds metric data points to a metric.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: euwatch-put-data -m METRIC -n NAMESPACE (-v FLOAT | -s Maximum=FLOAT,Minimum=FLOAT,SampleCount=F LOAT,Sum=FLOAT) [-d KEY1=VALUE1,KEY2=VALUE2,...] [-t YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ] [-u UNIT] [--show-empty-fields] [-U URL] [--region USER@REGION] [-I KEY_ID] [-S KEY] [--security-token TOKEN] [--debug] [--debugger] [--version] [-h]

row.entry: Name of the metric to which data points are to be added.
The dimensions of the metric to which data points are to be added.

Statistics to be provided for the given metric. You must specify each value you want for this option, or else Eucalyptus returns an error.
Valid key values: SampleCount | Sum | Maximum | Minimum

Timestamp of the data point. For example, 2009-11-25T19:00:00+00:00. Timestamp will be rounded down to the nearest minute. The dateTime type uses ISO 8601. The default for this option is the time that this request was sent.

The unit that the metric is being reported in.
Valid unit values are Seconds | Bytes | Bits | Percent | Count | Bytes/Second | Bits/Second | Count/Second | None
The value of the metric datum being put in.

section.title: Output
section.p: Eucalyptus does not return any output.

section.title: Examples
section.p: The following example puts statistic data for "RequestCount" in the "MyService" namespace. The metric contains no dimensions and so represents the overall RequestCount across the entire service. The measurement is a pre-aggregated statisticValue representing five earlier measurements whose maximum was 70, minimum was 30 and sum was 250.

The following example puts user-specific "RequestCount" test data in the "MyService" namespace. The user and stack name are stored as dimensions in order to distinguish this metric from the service-wide metric in the example above.
